main event: On April 8, 1956, in Rome, New York, there was a ground-visual observation of a possibly unidentified flying object resembling an aircraft silhouette with orange-red and blue colors. The observation lasted for an unspecified amount of time and was documented by the Air Force with the possibility of the object being a balloon or aircraft.
interesting points: The object was described as larger than a C-47 plane and had orange-red and blue colors.
The report includes the possibility of the object being a balloon or an aircraft, but no definitive conclusion was reached.
It was a ground-visual observation by military personnel at a specific location in Rome, New York.
The document mentions a change in the color of the flying object.
The report was based on observations made by military personnel and documented for Project Blue Book.
sighted object: unidentified flying object resembling an aircraft silhouette with orange-red and blue colors
